required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real World Study of Lapatinib Among Metastatic Breast Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Real World Study of Lapatinib Among Metastatic Breast Cancer Patients in Clinical Practice: a Multicenter, Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: A multicenter, retrospective, real world study of Lapatinib among Metastatic Breast Cancer (MBC) Patients in Clinical Practice.

detailed_description.textblock: This study collected patients used Lapatinib-base therapy among MBC, and tried to figure out if there was difference between single anti-Her2 treatment and dual anti-Her2 treatment. Furthermore, this study investigated the treatment after Lapatinib.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events version 4.0 (CTCAE v4.0)

arm_group.description: Patients continued using treatment containing Lapatinib after progression on Lapatinib.
Patients changed to another HER-2 targeted treatment after progression on Lapatinib (ado-trastuzumab emtansine, trastuzumab, etc.).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Lapatinib plus Trastuzumab and one chemotherapy
arm_group.description: Patients used lapatinib plus trastuzumab and one chemo regimen.

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with breast cancer (according to International Classification of Diseases-10, ICD-10) with confirmed metastasis, regardless of being de novo diagnosed or progressed from a non-metastatic stage.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who were treated with Lapatinib between June 2014 to June 2018.
- Patients experienced progression on prior trastuzumab-containing regimens and a taxane.
- Complete medical history was available.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical history was incomplete.
